description: MCP Server Configuration for Engineering Managers - Team Performance Bundle

github.description: GitHub integration for PR metrics, team velocity, and code review analytics
use_cases: Track team PR metrics (cycle time, review time, merge time)
Monitor code review quality and participation
Calculate DORA metrics (deployment frequency, lead time)
Generate sprint retrospective data from PR activity
github.why_essential: Central source of truth for engineering metrics and team performance

linear.description: Sprint planning, capacity management, and team velocity tracking
use_cases: Plan sprints with team capacity constraints
Manage team workload and prevent burnout
linear.why_essential: Best-in-class sprint planning and team capacity management

posthog.description: Engineering analytics, feature performance, and system health monitoring
use_cases: Track error rates and system stability
Analyze user impact of engineering work
posthog.why_essential: Data-driven engineering decisions and impact measurement

slack.description: Team coordination, incident management, and communication analytics
slack.why_essential: Critical for team coordination and incident management

memory.description: Persistent memory for team metrics, 1:1 notes, and performance history
use_cases: Store 1:1 discussion topics and action items
Remember team members' career goals and growth areas
Store retrospective action items and follow-up
memory.why_recommended: Essential for effective people management and continuity

postgres.description: DORA metrics queries, team performance analytics database
use_cases: Query DORA metrics database (deployment frequency, lead time, MTTR, change failure rate)
Analyze team productivity trends over time
postgres.why_recommended: Advanced metrics and analytics for data-driven management
postgres.security_note: Use read-only database user for safety

sequential-thinking.description: Structured planning for complex management decisions and technical strategy
use_cases: Technical debt prioritization and paydown strategy
Hiring pipeline planning and candidate evaluation
sequential-thinking.why_recommended: Critical for complex management decisions and strategic planning

required.GITHUB_TOKEN: GitHub personal access token (repo, workflow, read:org scopes)

sprint_planning.description: Data-driven sprint planning with capacity management
steps: 1. Use Linear to load backlog and team capacity
2. Query Postgres for historical velocity trends
3. Use GitHub to check team's current PR workload
4. Load team members' focus areas from memory
5. Balance workload across team
6. Create Linear cycle with assigned issues
7. Store sprint goals in memory
1. Load previous 1:1 notes and goals from memory
2. Query GitHub for PR metrics (reviews given, code quality)
3. Analyze Linear for velocity and task completion
4. Query Postgres for trend analysis over review period
5. Generate performance summary report
6. Store new goals and action items in memory

dora_metrics_analysis.description: Calculate and analyze DORA metrics for team
steps: 1. Query GitHub for deployment frequency (PR merge to main rate)
2. Calculate lead time for changes (first commit to production)
3. Use PostHog to track change failure rate
4. Query Postgres for MTTR (mean time to recovery)
5. Generate DORA metrics report
6. Send summary to Slack channel
1. Use Sequential-thinking for root cause analysis
2. Gather incident timeline from Slack messages
3. Analyze related PRs and deployments in GitHub
4. Generate action items for prevention
5. Store lessons learned in memory
6. Send retrospective summary to Slack

team_health_check.description: Weekly team health and workload analysis
steps: 1. Check Linear for sprint burndown and blocked issues
2. Analyze GitHub PR review queue and bottlenecks
3. Review PostHog error rates and system health
4. Load previous week's concerns from memory
5. Identify team members at risk of burnout
6. Generate team health report

technical_debt_planning.description: Prioritize and plan technical debt paydown
steps: 1. Use Sequential-thinking to categorize technical debt
2. Query GitHub for code quality metrics and hotspots
3. Analyze Linear for tech debt backlog
4. Query Postgres for system stability trends
5. Prioritize debt by impact and effort
6. Create Linear issues for planned work
